intro: Amphibromus scabrivalvis var. indigestus, commonly known as the rough-valved amphibromus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants known for their grass-like foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
